item.title: 中美谈判之际，"TACO "贸易为何吸引投资者？
item.description: 5 月 30 日，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普指责中国国家主席习近平打破贸易休战协议，使关税从 5 月初的极高点下降。投资者看到了墙上的字迹：关税将再次飙升，损害经济。股市下跌超过 1%。但就在同一天晚些时候，特朗普表示他将与习近平通话，乐观情绪和股票价格得以恢复。6 月 5 日，当通话最终成行时，S&P 500 指数再次短暂飙升。【原文：On May 30, US President Donald Trump accused his Chinese counterpart, President Xi Jinping, of breaking a trade truce that brought down tariffs from extreme highs in early May. Investors saw the writing on the wall: tariffs would spike again, hurting the economy. Stocks fell more than 1%. But later the same day, Trump said he’d have a conversation with Xi, and optimism – and stock prices – were restored. When the call finally happened on June 5, the S&P 500 Index again briefly surged.】

item.title: 企业 "灾难性 "前景减弱，加拿大利率维持不变
item.description: 企业认为最坏的关税情况不太可能成为现实，这有助于说服加拿大银行决策者本月保持观望。【原文：Businesses believing that the worst-case tariff scenarios were less likely to become reality helped convince Bank of Canada policymakers to stay on the sidelines this month.】

item.title: 随着人工智能光环的形成，微软创下自七月以来的首个纪录
item.description: 微软公司股价周四盘中创下新高，刷新了近一年来的历史新高，因为投资者越来越多地将这家软件巨头视为人工智能领域的大赢家。【原文：Microsoft Corp. shares rose to an intraday record on Thursday, taking out an all-time high that’s stood for nearly a year as investors increasingly see the software giant as a major winner with artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 如果通胀风险持续存在，美联储主席库格勒支持维持利率不变
item.description: 美联储理事阿德里安娜-库格勒（Adriana Kugler）表示，与唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税有关的更大规模的价格上涨是可能的，如果通胀上行风险挥之不去，她支持保持利率稳定。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said larger price increases related to President Donald Trump’s tariffs are likely, and that she supports holding interest rates steady if upside risks to inflation linger.】

item.title: 西门子能源为德国 75 亿欧元救援计划划上句号
item.description: 西门子能源股份公司（Siemens Energy AG）在取代德国政府支持的 110 亿欧元（126 亿美元）救援计划后，将在近四年来首次派发股息。【原文：Siemens Energy AG is on course to pay a dividend for the first time in almost four years after replacing an €11 billion ($12.6 billion) rescue package backed by the German government.】

item.title: 卢特尼克敦促美国更严格地执行对华出口限制措施
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）呼吁加强美国出口管制的执行力度，以防止中国窃取可能支持中国在人工智能和航空等领域的野心的美国关键技术。【原文：Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick called for stepped up enforcement of US export controls to prevent China from stealing critical American technologies that could support Beijing’s ambitions n areas like artificial intelligence and aviation.】

item.title: 埃斯克里瓦称欧洲央行关注关税政策对经济的影响
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员何塞-路易斯-埃斯克里瓦（Jose Luis Escriva）表示，决策者正在仔细观察美国关税对欧元区经济的影响。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Jose Luis Escriva said policymakers are carefully watching the impact of US tariffs on the euro-area economy.】

item.title: 瑞士军备部长寻求在防务竞赛中与欧洲建立更紧密的关系
item.description: 瑞士最高级别的武器采购官员正在寻求与欧洲邻国更紧密的合作，因为全球对武器的需求激增，而瑞士本国的国防工业却举步维艰。【原文：Switzerland’s most senior arms procurement official is seeking closer collaboration with European neighbors, as global demand for weapons surges and the nation’s own defense industry falters.】

item.title: 比特币 ATM 运营商 CoinFlip 探讨出售事宜
item.description: 随着加密货币领域交易的升温，全球比特币自动取款机网络运营商 CoinFlip 正处于权衡出售的早期阶段。【原文：CoinFlip, an operator of a global network Bitcoin ATMs, is in the early stages of weighing a sale as dealmaking in the cryptocurrency space heats up, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 交易员评估内塔尼亚胡联盟困境，以色列资产上涨
item.description: 由于市场开始考虑到本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理的政府面临垮台的风险，以色列的债券和股票都出现了上涨。【原文：Israel’s bonds and stocks rose as markets began factoring in that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government was at risk of collapse, an outcome that some traders view as a positive for the economy.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员预计七月暂停，部分官员认为 2% 是终点
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲央行官员设想在 7 月份制定下一次政策时暂停降息行动。【原文：European Central Bank officials envisage a pause in their interest rate-cutting campaign when they next set policy in July, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国因贸易僵局连续第二个月放弃购买美国石油
item.description: 由于中国与美国的贸易争端继续扰乱市场，世界最大的石油进口国中国连续第二个月避免购买美国原油。【原文：China, the world’s largest oil importer, avoided buying American crude for a second straight month as the nation’s trade dispute with the US continues to unsettle markets.】

item.title: 欧盟推出工具监测特朗普关税造成的贸易转移
item.description: 欧盟委员会正式启动了一项监督工具，以监测美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税所导致的任何贸易转移，因为初步结果显示许多商品的进口激增。【原文：The European Commission has formally launched a surveillance tool to monitor any trade diversion resulting from US President Donald Trump’s tariffs, as initial results revealed a surge of imports in many goods.】

item.title: 国防初创企业 Anduril 以 305 亿美元估值获得融资
item.description: 安杜里尔工业公司（Anduril Industries Inc. 执行主席特雷-斯蒂芬斯（Trae Stephens）在接受彭博电视采访时表示，该公司已完成新一轮 25 亿美元的融资，这笔交易使这家国防初创公司的估值翻了一番多，达到 305 亿美元。【原文：Anduril Industries Inc. has closed a new funding round of $2.5 billion, a deal that more than doubles the defense startup’s valuation to $30.5 billion, its executive chairman Trae Stephens said in an interview on Bloomberg Television.】

item.title: 丹麦央行效仿欧洲央行降息四分之一个点
item.description: 丹麦中央银行将其主要利率下调了 25 个基点，与欧元区的央行持平，以维护克朗与共同货币的挂钩关系。【原文：Denmark’s central bank reduced its key interest rate by 25 basis points, matching its euro-area counterpart, to defend the krone’s peg to the common currency.】

item.description: ING Groep NV 首席执行官史蒂文-范赖斯韦克（Steven van Rijswijk）表示，在增加了希望留在银行作为安全缓冲的资金后，他今年可能会放慢股票回购的步伐。【原文：ING Groep NV Chief Executive Officer Steven van Rijswijk said he may slow the pace of share buybacks this year after increasing the amount of money he wants to keep in the bank as safety cushion.】

item.description: 尽管全球市场对关税谈判结果存在不确定性，但南非资产仍在不断增长。【原文：South African assets are on the march despite uncertainty in global markets over the outcome of tariff negotiations.】

item.title: 摩根大通和摩根士丹利将数据中心交易出售给私人信贷机构
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根大通和摩根士丹利正在为数据中心运营商 TeraWulf Inc.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Morgan Stanley are arranging a debt deal for data center operator TeraWulf Inc., which the banks intend to sell to private credit firms, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉与小型石油公司合作，雪佛龙公司缩减规模
item.description: 据熟悉协议内容的人士透露，委内瑞拉国营石油公司已与外国服务供应商签署了至少九项新协议，其中包括两家中国公司，目的是在美国制裁迫使雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.【原文：Venezuela’s state-run oil company has signed at least nine new deals with foreign service providers, including two Chinese firms, in an effort to keep dollars flowing into the economy after US sanctions forced Chevron Corp. to end production, according to people familiar with the agreements.】

item.title: 私人信贷将贷款转入新基金以偿还投资者
item.description: 由于缺乏并购、筹款荒以及美国关税引发的波动，私人信贷公司不得不寻找其他途径向投资者返还现金，因此延续基金正大量涌入市场。【原文：Private credit firms are flooding the market with continuation funds, as a lack of mergers and acquisitions, a fundraising drought and US tariff-induced volatility force them to find other ways to return cash to investors.】

item.title: 预计欧洲央行仅再减息一次，德国债券下跌
item.description: 由于欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示欧洲央行可能即将暂停降息，交易商减少了对欧洲央行未来降息的押注，德国短期债券下跌。【原文：German short-dated bonds fell as traders pared bets on future interest-rate cuts by the European Central Bank, with President Christine Lagarde indicating that it may be approaching a pause.】

item.title: 贸易紧张局势下特朗普与习近平通话的报道引发美股飙升
item.description: 据报道，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普与中国国家主席习近平通了电话，美股因此大涨，抹去了早些时候因失业救济人数意外跳升而造成的跌幅。【原文：US stocks jumped on reports of a phone call between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping, erasing earlier losses driven by unexpected jump in jobless claims.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会对加密货币的困惑加深，新一代 ETF 测试边界
item.description: 就在特朗普政府放松对数字资产的监管之际，一系列追逐收益率的新型加密货币基金正迫使美国证券交易委员会正视其监管框架中尚未解决的漏洞。【原文：A new line of yield-chasing crypto funds is forcing the Securities and Exchange Commission to confront unresolved gaps in its regulatory framework, just as the Trump administration eases oversight of digital assets.】

item.title: 吉姆-查诺斯认为赛勒的战略是个大空头，但其他人并不确定
item.description: 买入比特币，做空迈克尔-赛勒的策略。这是传奇空头卖家吉姆-查诺斯（Jim Chanos）的最新呼吁，他认为这种套利行为毫无疑问。其他人则不这么认为。【原文：Buy Bitcoin, short Michael Saylor’s Strategy. That’s the latest call from legendary short-seller Jim Chanos, who sees the arbitrage play as a no-brainer. Others aren’t so sure.】
